intro: Ectopopterys, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of a single species, Ectopopterys subacaulis, which is native to the Andes mountains in South America. The plant is characterized by its large, umbrella-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its striking appearance and unique growth habits, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
